abstract: Could everything compute? Some philosophical implications of pancomputationalism view on natural computing Natural computing is an important concept of modern computer science. It brings some conceptual bridges between classical computer science and natural sciences. It plays also interesting role in development of contemporary philosophy, and it is tied with the metaphysical concept of pancomputationalism. This article shows some impact of natural computing on philosophy (philosophy of science, metaphysics, and worldview). KEY WORDS: natural computing, pancomputationalism, philosophy of computing, methodology of computing, informational worldview.
meta: Project: Philosophy of computing - ontological and methodological issues
